description: '''Bernard Alfred''' "'''Jack'''" '''Nitzsche''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|n|iː|tʃ|i}} ''{{respell|NEECH|ee}}''; April 22, 1937 – August 25, 2000) was an American musician, arranger, songwriter, composer, and record producer. He came to prominence in the early 1960s as the right-hand-man of producer [[Phil Spector]], and went on to work with [[the Rolling Stones]], [[Neil Young]], and others. He worked extensively in film scores for the films ''[[Performance (film)|Performance]]'', ''[[The Exorcist]]'' and ''[[One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest (film)|One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest]]''. In 1983, he won the [[Academy Award for Best Original Song]] for co-writing "[[Up Where We Belong]]" with [[Buffy Sainte-Marie]].
